newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Mt Kersey in Gindalbie metal search jv.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Mt Kersey in Gindalbie metal search jv.

text.p: Mt Kersey Mining NL said on Monday that it has entered a joint venture with Gindalbie Gold NL to explore tenements next to Gindalbie's nickel project which adjoins the Silver Swan nickel deposit, 65 km north east of Kalgoorlie in Western Australia.

Under the deal, Mt Kersey will earn a 70 percent interest in the venture by sole funding expenditure of A$8 million within five years. Gindalbie is not required to contribute until Mt Kersey has spent the full A$8 million on the tenements.
Mt Kersey said previous work by Gindalbie had identified a number of interesting gold anomalies.
"Regional exploration principally for gold but including base metals will also be a priority for the company," Mt Kersey said in a statement to the Australian Stock Exchange.

In an earlier announcement by Mt Kersey in response to a share price query by the ASX, Mt Kersey said it could offer no explanation as to why its shares had risen to a high of A$4.95 on August 23 from A$4.00 on August 20.
Mt Kersey said draft unaudited financial statements for the company disclosed an operating loss before abnormal items and tax of A$1.19 million for the year to June 30, 1996.
At 11.15 a.m. (0115 GMT), Mt Kersey shares were six cents higher at A$5.01. Gindalbie shares were up two at 40 cents.
